website_summaries.verdict: In theory, a print server can be useful, but the Linksys WPS54GU2 is not reliable enough for us to recommend.
pros: Connects to parallel- and USB-based printers

customer_reviews.title: Not new
customer_reviews.text: It was used with a $4.99 sticker from Goodwill! We purchased a new one, not refurbished!!!
customer_reviews.author: D & K

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these in 05 for my first wlan at the house. It took two evenings to get it to work. But it worked well for two XP boxes in different rooms for years.Time went past, gear changed, needs changed, etc. and I gave it away. I bought another one this month to connect my laser printer. After an afternoon on my own and then 3+ hours on the fone with Linksys it works only with an ancient Vista laptop I pulled out of storage, and then it has to be hardwired to the router. It will not work with my Win 7 laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Boschen

customer_reviews.title: Setup on my network easily. Connecting to a modern computer
customer_reviews.text: Setup on my network easily. Connecting to a modern computer? Nope. It requires NetBIOS or TCP/IP to be enabled (well, duh!). Unfortunately, the drivers were written to look for a specific string in the registry indicating that the network protocols were installed and somewhere around Windows 8.1 Microsoft changed the syntax of the network protocol name. So the drivers won't install and it's useless. Hence the 1 star review and the return.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Halstead

customer_reviews.title: Just sent my second one back...
customer_reviews.text: First arrived w/ damaged power adapter; Amazon was good about sending a replacement, which appeared intact on arrival. But after an hour on my own (I'm fairly tech-savvy) and TWO HOURS in 'chat' with Linksys tech support, it still wasn't (a) talking to my wireless network (Linksys) or (b) talking to my printer (HP Laserjet 1000). I'm hoping for better luck with Netgear. To their credit, the Linksys tech support were responsive and reasonably capable; the hardware was just shoddy.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with newer printers
customer_reviews.text: This was working fine for a couple years with a Brother laser printer, but it does not work with newer printers. I later found that this is true for most of the print servers on the market, except the ones that specifically say for newer or multi-function printers. But, I would just but the network ready printer in the future to avoid using a sharing device like this.
customer_reviews.author: wenwayne

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it works!
customer_reviews.text: When I received the Linksys WPS54GU3 I spent too much time trying to make it work. I called Linksys customer support and tried everything they suggested. It still wouldn't work as a "wireless" print server. I mailed it back and got another one that worked properly using my wireless network to set it up. It works great now with two computers and two printers on my wireless network. Looks like Linksys shipped a lot of untested product and is struggling to correct the problems. If I had it to do over again I would go with another brand. These people don't deserve good customers.
customer_reviews.author: hwillie

customer_reviews.title: INCOMPATIBLE WITH MULTIFUNCTION PRINTERS
customer_reviews.text: This product is impossible to install with multifunction printers like the HP PSC series. I spent two hours on the phone with Linksys tech support. They were unable to get this print server working and finally concluded that their product didn't support multi-function printers. Note that Linksys did not indicate this limitation in their advertisement for the product, in their spec sheet or in their requirements. Don't waste your time with any Linksys product. Try another networking company and make sure that you ask BEFORE YOU BUY whether the product works with your printer.
customer_reviews.author: Princeton man

customer_reviews.title: Poor Instructions, Support, and Performance
customer_reviews.text: For all the great reputation that Linksys has, this product is a non-starter when it comes to set-up and tech support. The scant instruction card details connection to a WIRED network without explaining that it must be initially done so before becoming wireless. And even then, there is no promise that it will be compatibale with a non-Linksys wireless router. After two or three hours trying to determine what I was doing wrong, I contacted Linksys tech support. Twenty-four hours later, their reply directed me to a weblink that had nothing to do with the product, let alone the problem. I returned the thing to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: O. Nordstrom

customer_reviews.title: Died after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Was working and then just died. Now it does nothing and just has a faint buzz. very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not Really Wireless
customer_reviews.text: OK, when I ordered this "wireless" adapter, I figured it could be hooked up to the printer and accessed wirelessly. Nope. It needs to be wired into your router. How many of you have your router sitting next to your printer? Not me; hope you do! This ended up being absolutely useless for my application and non-returnable. Be careful about what you order and how it connects.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware-  No WPA security
customer_reviews.text: How sad that after all the talk about the necessity of WPA security for a home wireless network, Linksys only shipped this print server with rudimentary WEP security. This is despite the fact that linksys's other wireless products DO support WPA security. As far as I know, users using WPA on their networks are out of luck as no other brands seem to be offering print servers with this feature. I spent 5 hours trying to configure this piece of hardware, only to find that it was uncompatible with my network. I will be returning it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Dando

customer_reviews.title: Wow-Bummer
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I was thrilled of the ease of installation. Then when I tried to install on my spouse's laptop, I spent a full day without full success. She generally works from home wifi, and connects to her work server via a secured cloud based network. Do to the cloud based network security, we cannot connect via the wifi only when laptop is hardwired will the printer work.
customer_reviews.author: Loran L. Zlomke

customer_reviews.title: but the seller did stipulate that it was not compatible with any windows operating system past windows xp and therefore it is us
customer_reviews.text: The product was working, but the seller did stipulate that it was not compatible with any windows operating system past windows xp and therefore it is useless and obsolete, Good old obsolete server, poor seller information.
customer_reviews.author: telecaster60k

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, weird disappointing  product with no WPA support--returned it
customer_reviews.text: I had been very happy with my Linksys B and G wireless routers, so I decided to give this a shot. What a mistake! I didn't realize until I tried to set this up that it doesn't support WPA security, only the older insecure WEP. That's not acceptable. I cannot lower the security of my network to use this product and I wouldn't recommend anyone else doing so. Another weird thing is that it requires a print server driver to be installed on every computer that will use the print server. Why ? Overall a very poor design that should have never been made. I expect more from Cisco.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald F. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: The box could not find my network. After calling ...
customer_reviews.text: The box could not find my network. After calling Cisco Help, I found out that the box does not support Windows7. The representative's explanation made sense, ie most printers available in the last couple of years are wireless and folks don't need wireless servers. The cost of getting a wireless printer (even a 3 in 1) is the same as trying te printer server.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: was not what it was advertised to be
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because it was advertised to work with Windows 7. It could not be further from the truth. This print server does not work with any Windows program beyond Windows Vista. Bitterly disappointing! Additionally, when I called Linksys for technical support, I learned the print server I had was manufactured in 2004. It was sitting in a box for nine (9) years, and it was being sold as a new item. Personally, I believe that it all fell under the topic of FALSE ADVERTISING!
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Misleading, sloppy, incomplete manual
customer_reviews.text: If I did not already understand wireless networking and security, I never would have been able to get it working. Yes, it works fine, but I cannot recommend the unit. How expensive or how difficult can it be to write a concise and accurate manual? I came close to returning the unit, but found nothing better.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Papanos

customer_reviews.title: No problems, prints beautifully from 3 different computers
customer_reviews.text: I experienced no problems with installing this print server by following the directions included to the "T". It prints quickly and beautifully using the wireless from 3 different computers (all running XP Pro) to a Brother HL-2030 and a Canon i860. I haven't had it long enough to know if it will require frequent resets, but right now I am tickled to death!
customer_reviews.author: tech geek

customer_reviews.title: Warranty expired before receipt of item
customer_reviews.text: Print server warranty expired on shelf and Cisco-Linksys very reluctant to provide tech support - they only tried to help when they saw how upset I was with their print server. Print server did not work with Win7 and would not work wireless and they could not resolve problem. I really believe the vendor is at fault for selling this item. Returned to Amazon for refund.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Joffrion Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to configure, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It is easy to configure-about 10 minutes. It is easy to use for wired and/or wireless applications or hybrid of both. I have not had any trouble out of the two I have. It will drive both USB and parallel printers.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Sad adapter.
customer_reviews.text: Never got it to work. Had to pay shipping to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, once you get it configured correctly
customer_reviews.text: I've got this unit to finally print from both a WinXP and Mac OS X machine, to a parallel port HP-6L and a USB port Canon i850. It's fairly straightforward to follow the manual to print from Windows, but if you want to print from OS X, you need to specify "L2" for the USB port server, not "P2" as in Windows and the manual.
customer_reviews.author: pixelquarium

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this easy to set up print server. I did however have to sit on the phone to figure out how to set up the second printer, but it was worth it! Now I can print from anywhere in the house! WOOHOO!
customer_reviews.author: E. Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Product is no longer supported by LinkSys and it did ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is no longer supported by LinkSys and it did not work with Windows 10. Why sell this old product withoutr some warning!
customer_reviews.author: norman d berger

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The prongs off of the power cord broke off within 5 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Not for Multifunction Printers
customer_reviews.text: I tried unsuccessfully to install this WPS only to find out it does not support multifunction/ all in one printers. It is designed for "regular" printers according to Linksys live chat helpdesk. ++++++ MAKE SURE TO CHECK THAT YOUR PRINTER IS SUPPORTED BEFORE BUYING+++++++++
customer_reviews.author: Diego E. Coppola

customer_reviews.title: Isn't compatable with new printer.
customer_reviews.text: I use a new HP laserJet 1022 printer. This particular print server is not compatable with it. I called linksys and after much wasted time, I was informed that there was no way to solve the incompatability issue. I wish I had know about this before I purchased the item. EVERYON BEWARE! CHECK WITH LINKSYS FIRST TO SEE IF YOUR PRINTER IS COMPATIBLE WITH THE PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Waldron

customer_reviews.title: Multifunction Printer Owners Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I suppose this product might be good for those of you who have non-multifunctional printers, i.e., printer/scanner/copier. However, I (like many of you) have a multifunction printer - a Lexmark X83 to be precise - and this print server is not compatible with this model of printer. This was verified by tech support at Linksys. The tech rep even told me that most multifunction machines are not compatible with this. Needless to say, I returned it. You have been forewarned.
customer_reviews.author: Remember the Maine!

customer_reviews.title: This product is no longer manufactured, or supported by Linksys
customer_reviews.text: This product is not represented fully in the discription and after two hours of attempting to setup I contacted Linksys and was told by them that this product is no longer manufactured, or supported. In fact the unit that I received was manufactured in 2004 and it is not compatible with the current Windows OS or current wireless networking hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Great product for old parallel printers
customer_reviews.text: Great product for old parallel printers. Works as advertised, although I am not currently using the wireless functionality - I have it hooked up with a cable.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to allow two wirelessly connected computers to use one printer. I particularly wanted the Linksys because I have an ALL-Linksys type of wireless system already. It makes a big difference if you can stick with the same company's products as far as compatibility is concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii CFI

customer_reviews.title: No luck
customer_reviews.text: This may be a good product, but I have yet to find firmware that works under windows 8.1. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Pabs2310

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I have been on the phone, and on the internet with LINKSYS support suince I received this ite, The install discs did not work. The support personnel cannot help. After an HOUR on the phone, stumped, you are CUT OFF and have to start over. E-Mails to LINKSYS are ignored. I am NOT computer illeterate, but you have to have a systems degree to install this unit. Mine is still sitting here like a lump--I will return it to Amazon and ask for costs of shipping as THIS IS A USELESS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: H. LiMarzi

customer_reviews.title: Does not support multi function printers
customer_reviews.text: The manual nor tech support seem to know this until you get to level II tech. That's when they informed me the server would not work with multi function printers.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: could not get a straight answer form customer suport
customer_reviews.text: could not get answer to how to make it work called and took my time several times but was not able to get a person who spoke english or understood how to make it work
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Black

customer_reviews.title: Only works with Windows XP!
customer_reviews.text: This little caveot was not in the description of the device. I returned the product, and this process, along with the refund process, worked well. But avoid this product for any Windows 7 / 8, unix or non-XP environment.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C

customer_reviews.title: purchase via amazon
customer_reviews.text: I needed this print router for some special work I was doing. I was able to complete my task successfully.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Tummino

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible
customer_reviews.text: No incompatibility list from the vendor... it just never worked. It did not work with any of MY printers, multi-function or single-function, ink jet or laser jet per Linksys. They need a compatibility list. Worst Linksys product I have every attempted use.
customer_reviews.author: W. Sellars

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Shame on you amazon for selling such a piece of old junk. I paid $75 for a print server that does not support WPA or WPA2. There should not be anyone with a home network still running WEP. I wish I could give zero stars. Amazon take this off your store. It is like ordering a car and getting a horse and buggy. I blame Amazon on this.
customer_reviews.author: Jaminmobile

customer_reviews.title: This print server just does not work
customer_reviews.text: I have an ordinary laser printer and this print server cannot print to that laser printer. Technical support is useless. It just kept asking me useless questions. Don't buy this product
customer_reviews.author: G. LO

product_meta.title: Cisco-Linksys WPS54GU2 Wireless-G Print Server for USB 2.0Cisco-Linksys WPS54GU2 Wireless-G Print Server for USB 2.0  discontinued by manufacturer
product_meta.description:
The Linksys Wireless G PrintServer for USB 2.0 lets you connect a USB or parallel printer (or both!) directly to your network, eliminating the need to dedicate a PC to print sharing chores. Using a PrintServer frees up your "print share PC" so you don't have to leave it on all the time. It also removes the printing bottleneck, and sets your PC free to do more useful work. Connect the PrintServer directly to your network by 10/100 Ethernet cable, or wirelessly over 54Mbps Wireless G (802.11g). The wireless option lets you put your printers wherever you want to, without having to run cables. Whichever way the PrintServer is attached to your network, both your wireless and wired PCs will have access to it, and the printers it's connected to. And if you don't use wireless for general networking in your office, you can still use the Wireless G connection in ad hoc mode to print from visiting Wireless G and Wireless B PCs. The USB port is compatible with USB 1.1 printers, as well as printers that support the new high speed USB 2.0 specification for even faster throughput. There's also a separate port for a standard parallel printer. For even more versatility, you can connect two printers, one to each port, and send your documents to whichever one is most appropriate for each print job. A user friendly Setup Wizard makes installation easy, the compact case fits anywhere, and the three megabyte print buffer size handles even large graphics intensive print jobs. Let the Linksys Wireless G PrintServer for USB 2.0 bring efficiency to your printing tasks.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Linksys Wireless-G PrintServer for USB 2.0 lets you connect a USB or parallel printer (or both!) directly to your network, eliminating the need to dedicate a PC to print sharing chores. Using a PrintServer frees up your "print share PC" so you don't have to leave it on all the time. It also removes the printing bottleneck, and sets your PC free to do more useful work. 

 Connect the PrintServer directly to your network by 10/100 Ethernet cable, or wirelessly over 54Mbps Wireless-G (802.11g). The wireless option lets you put your printers wherever you want to, without having to run cables. Whichever way the PrintServer is attached to your network, both your wireless and wired PCs will have access to it, and the printers it's connected to. And if you don't use wireless for general networking in your office, you can still use the Wireless-G connection in ad-hoc mode to print from visiting Wireless-G and Wireless-B PCs. 

 The USB port is compatible with USB 1.1 printers, as well as printers that support the new high-speed USB 2.0 specification for even faster throughput. There's also a separate port for a standard parallel printer. For even more versatility, you can connect two printers, one to each port, and send your documents to whichever one is most appropriate for each print job. 

 A user-friendly Setup Wizard makes installation easy, the compact case fits anywhere, and the three megabyte print buffer size handles even large graphics-intensive print jobs. Let the Linksys Wireless-G PrintServer for USB 2.0 bring efficiency to your printing tasks.
feature_bullets: Share up to two printers with everyone on your network works with most parallel and USB (1.1 or 2.0) printers
Connects your printers directly to the network by 10/100 wired Ethernet or 54Mbps Wireless G (802.11g)
No need to dedicate a PC to print server chores. PLEASE BE AWARE THIS ROUTER DOES NOT SUPPORT PRINTER SCANNING OR FAXING FUNCTIONS. IT IS DESIGNED TO ONLY SUPPORT PRINTER PRINTING FUNCTIONS
Remotely administered through your web browser, SNMP, or the included utility
Legacy product, supports Windows 98, 2000, XP, and Vista. Does not support Windows 7 / 8 / 10. Easy installation with Setup Wizard

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.4 out of 5 stars184 ratings2.4 out of 5 stars
